result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Bradley J. LaBarge
Current: 936 Maple Hill Rd, Wausau, WI 54403 United States  (Effective: 11-18-2019)
Prior: 509 N. 12 Street #1/2, Wausau, WI 54403

Case Called: 10:53 am
INCLUDES 14CF519, 15CF261, 15CF502.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig. Defendant appears in person, pro se.
Defendant has completed DEOJ Agreement. 
State moves to: Amend Ct. 1 to (Possession of THC).
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.
COURT ORDERS:
14CF519:
Ct. 1 (Possession of THC)>> $5 fine plus Court Costs.

Defendant to contact Wausau PD to obtain items that were seized.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on June 15, 2018 at 10:45 am.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 8:51 am 
INCLUDES 14CF519, 15CF261, AND 15CF502. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty Austin Mort.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to:
In 14CF519: Ct. 2 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF261: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF502: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 14CF519: Ct. 1 (Possess with Intent -THC)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Possession of THC)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, def guilty, and defers entry of judgment on Ct. 1 in 14CF519. 
State makes statement. Atty Mort makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 14CF519 on Ct. 1>>DEOJ for 3 years with conditions as outlined in written agreement - if def successfully completes DEOJ agreement, State will move to amend charge to misd. possession of THC with fine of $5 plus costs. 
In 14CF519 on Cts. 3-5>>SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: 117 days MCJ with huber or EMP if def qualifies under jail criteria; 25 hours community service - not to be done in amount less than 2 hours a month; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not perform 10 hours of community service per week; court costs; $305 (on Ct. 3 only). 
COURT finds def is entitled to 3 days jail credit. 
COURT modifies bond in 14CF519 to remove day report condition. 
Atty Mort requests release of any noncontrabond property that was seized. State has no objection to non-evidence being returned. COURT grants return of non-evidence. 
Review of DEOJ set for June 15, 2018 at 10:45 am with Br. 3 Judge. 
Adj: 9:13 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 15, 2015 at 08:45 am.
Status conference on April 28, 2015 at 08:45 am.
